Articles.Content:
This is one of my better aircraft designs for both control and versatility. Right now I have only made a lower and upper atmospheric versions. I have not had a lot of experience with making jets, so im sure it could perform better ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Prometheus (Standard)**

> ![screenshot10.png](http://i826.photobucket.com/albums/zz185/AesusVaro/screenshot10.png)
> It can carry more, I just didnt want to get TOO carried away..
> 
> ![screenshot8.png](http://i826.photobucket.com/albums/zz185/AesusVaro/screenshot8.png)
> 
> The two levels of wings allows for a pretty heavy payload without any real big problems.
> 
> ![screenshot3-1.png](http://i826.photobucket.com/albums/zz185/AesusVaro/screenshot3-1.png)
> 
> The underside.
> 
> ![screenshot7-1.png](http://i826.photobucket.com/albums/zz185/AesusVaro/screenshot7-1.png)
> 
> And of course an action shot! Careful when firing the top missiles though, if you are pulling up there might be a catastrophic failure......

**Prometheus (Upper Atmosphere)**

> ![screenshot11.png](http://i826.photobucket.com/albums/zz185/AesusVaro/screenshot11.png)
> Two engines and 4 fuel tanks added.
> 
> ![screenshot14.png](http://i826.photobucket.com/albums/zz185/AesusVaro/screenshot14.png)
> 
> Transitioning from standard engines to turbojet engines.
> 
> ![screenshot15.png](http://i826.photobucket.com/albums/zz185/AesusVaro/screenshot15.png)
> 
> Holding the jet upside down before detaching the spent turbojets and tanks usually keeps any collisions from occurring.

I did attempt to make an amphibious one but its hard to slow down enough so hitting the water doesn\'t lead to a flamey death, so I put that on hold.
